exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type a : A Unable to unify "Prop" with "RIntro True (req a) a a".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
a: A

Goal:
RIntro True (req a) a a

Premises:
RIntro = fun (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) => P -> R m n : forall A B : Type, Prop -> rel A B -> A -> B -> Prop Arguments RIntro {A B}%type_scope _%type_scope _%rel_scope
Inductive True : Prop := I : True
Inductive req (A : Type) (a : A) : rel A A := req_intro : req a a a Arguments req {A}%type_scope Arguments req_intro {A}%type_scope
rel_top_rintro : forall (x : ?A) (y : ?B), RIntro True ⊤ x y where ?A : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?B : [A : Type a : A |- Type]
BinInt.Z.sqrt_sqrt_up_spec : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.sqrt a) (BinInt.Z.sqrt a)) a /\ BinInt.Z.le a (BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.sqrt_up a) (BinInt.Z.sqrt_up a))
rel_top = fun (A B : Type) (_ : A) (_ : B) => True : forall A B : Type, rel A B Arguments rel_top {A B}%type_scope
flip_rintro : forall (R : rel ?A ?B) (m : ?B) (n : ?A), RIntro (R n m) (flip R) m n where ?A : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?B : [A : Type a : A |- Type]
BinInt.Z.sqrt_up_square : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.sqrt_up (BinInt.Z.mul a a) = a
rel_inter_glb : forall R R1 R2 : rel ?A ?B, RIntro (subrel R R1 /\ subrel R R2) subrel R (R1 /\ R2)%rel where ?A : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?B : [A : Type a : A |- Type]
rel_union_lub : forall R1 R2 R : rel ?A ?B, RIntro (subrel R1 R /\ subrel R2 R) subrel (R1 \/ R2)%rel R where ?A : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?B : [A : Type a : A |- Type]
rel_push_rintro : forall (f : ?A1 -> ?B1) (g : ?A2 -> ?B2) (R : rel ?A1 ?A2) (x : ?A1) (y : ?A2), RIntro (R x y) R !! (f, g) (f x) (g y) where ?A1 : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?A2 : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?B1 : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?B2 : [A : Type a : A |- Type]
arrow_pointwise_rintro : forall (R : rel ?B1 ?B2) (f : ?A -> ?B1) (g : ?A -> ?B2), RIntro (forall x : ?A, R (f x) (g x)) (- ==> R) f g where ?A : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?B1 : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?B2 : [A : Type a : A |- Type]
Znumtheory.Zdivide_opp_l : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide a b -> BinInt.Z.divide (BinInt.Z.opp a) b
Znumtheory.Zdivide_opp_l_rev : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide (BinInt.Z.opp a) b -> BinInt.Z.divide a b
rel_impl_rintro : forall (R1 R2 : rel ?A ?B) (x : ?A) (y : ?B), RIntro (R1 x y -> R2 x y) (rel_impl R1 R2) x y where ?A : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?B : [A : Type a : A |- Type]
BinInt.Z.sqrt_up_nonneg : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.sqrt_up a)
BinInt.Z.sqrt_up_le_mono : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le a b -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.sqrt_up a) (BinInt.Z.sqrt_up b)
arrow_rintro : forall (RA : rel ?A1 ?A2) (RB : rel ?B1 ?B2) (f : ?A1 -> ?B1) (g : ?A2 -> ?B2), RIntro (forall (x : ?A1) (y : ?A2), RA x y -> RB (f x) (g y)) (RA ++> RB) f g where ?A1 : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?A2 : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?B1 : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?B2 : [A : Type a : A |- Type]
BinInt.Z.sqrt_up_le_square : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 b -> BinInt.Z.le a (BinInt.Z.mul b b) < -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.sqrt_up a) b
forall_pointwise_rintro : forall (FE : forall v : ?V, rel (?FV1 v) (?FV2 v)) (f : forall x : ?V, ?FV1 x) (g : forall x : ?V, ?FV2 x), RIntro (forall v : ?V, FE v (f v) (g v)) (forallr - @ v, FE v) f g where ?V : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?FV1 : [A : Type a : A |- ?V -> Type] ?FV2 : [A : Type a : A |- ?V -> Type]
forallp_rintro : forall (FE : forall (v1 : ?V1) (v2 : ?V2), rel (?F1 v1) (?F2 v2)) (f : forall x : ?V1, ?F1 x) (g : forall x : ?V2, ?F2 x), RIntro (forall (v1 : ?V1) (v2 : ?V2), ?E v1 v2 -> FE v1 v2 (f v1) (g v2)) (forallr v1 v2 : ?E, FE v1 v2) f g where ?V1 : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?V2 : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?E : [A : Type a : A |- rel ?V1 ?V2] ?F1 : [A : Type a : A |- ?V1 -> Type] ?F2 : [A : Type a : A |- ?V2 -> Type]
rintro = fun (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (RIntro : RIntro P R m n) => RIntro : forall (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B), RIntro P R m n -> P -> R m n Arguments rintro {A B P}%type_scope {R}%rel_scope {m n RIntro}
forall_rintro : forall (FE : forall (x : ?V1) (y : ?V2), ?E x y -> rel (?F1 x) (?F2 y)) (f : forall x : ?V1, ?F1 x) (g : forall x : ?V2, ?F2 x), RIntro (forall (u : ?V1) (v : ?V2) (e : ?E u v), FE u v e (f u) (g v)) (forallr e @ v1 v2, FE v1 v2 e) f g where ?V1 : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?V2 : [A : Type a : A |- Type] ?E : [A : Type a : A |- ?V1 -> ?V2 -> Type] ?F1 : [A : Type a : A |- ?V1 -> Type] ?F2 : [A : Type a : A |- ?V2 -> Type]
Field_theory.rdiv6 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall a b : R, ~ req a rO -> ~ req b rO -> req (rinv (rdiv a b)) (rdiv b a)
rintro_rstep = fun (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (H : RIntro P R m n) => H : forall (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B), RIntro P R m n -> RStep P (R m n) Arguments rintro_rstep {A B P}%type_scope {R}%rel_scope {m n}
req_rect : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (P : A -> A -> Type), P a a -> forall y y0 : A, req a y y0 -> P y y0
req_rec : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (P : A -> A -> Set), P a a -> forall y y0 : A, req a y y0 -> P y y0
req_ind : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (P : A -> A -> Prop), P a a -> forall y y0 : A, req a y y0 -> P y y0
